job description:
Computational Biologist, X

Hardware Engineering

Mountain View, CA (HQ)

Team:

This role is for a confidential, early-stage moonshot technology.

Responsibilities:

+ Design statistical decision-making agronomic tools (e.g. yield estimation, genetic prediction, drivers of stress) for real-world users

+ Collaborate with hardware team and ML experts to define precision, accuracy, sensor type and environmental measurement needed to capture plant traits of interest.

+ Conduct academic literature review (e.g. phenotyping, crop modeling) and stay abreast of relevant work in the research community. Summarize findings to the team on a monthly basis and lead internal investigations into areas of interest.

+ Build relationships with leading public ag research organizations in appropriate domains and be the agronomy expert representing the teams capabilities to partners and customers.

+ Represent the voice of the breeder and voice of the farmer on the team and lead experimental design development for each project.

Minimum Qualifications:

+ Bachelors degree in biostatistics, bioinformatics, crop modelling, or agronomy

+ 3 years work or research experience in applied agricultural technology

+ Programming experience in R, Python.

Preferred Qualifications:

+ Familiarity with a breadth of crops.

+ Able to explain complex concepts to a non-ag audience

+ Familiarity with farming and/or precision agriculture strongly preferred
